document.docTitle: Edosa elongata Yang, Wang & Li, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the genus Edosa Walker, 1886 from China (Lepidoptera, Tineidae, Perissomasticinae)

, sp. nov.

Diagnosis. This new species is similar to
E. conchata
sp. nov.
and
E. sinica (Gaedike, 1984 )
, but differs from the latter two species in the tegumen being membraneous medially, sclerotized and pincer-shaped laterally, and the elongate rectangular valva with a basal flange. In the latter two species, the tegumen is simple, the short valva is scallop-shaped in
E. conchata
sp. nov.
and ear-shaped in
E. sinica
, and the basal flange is absent.

Pregenital abdomen. First tergum without sclerotization. In male, coremata present in eighth segment; eighth sternite 0.16× as long as wide, without caudal process; eighth tergite 0.25× as long as wide, without caudal process. In female, seventh sternite triangularly concave at middle on posterior margin.
Distribution. China (Chongqing, Fujian, Gansu, Hainan, Hubei, Hunan, Yunnan, Zhejiang).

Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Latin elongatus , meaning elongate, referring to the elongate valva, the elongate aedeagus, and the elongate T-shaped medial process on the vinculum ventrocaudal margin.
